014package org.microbean.assign;
015
016import java.lang.constant.ClassDesc;
017import java.lang.constant.Constable;
018import java.lang.constant.ConstantDesc;
019import java.lang.constant.DynamicConstantDesc;
020import java.lang.constant.MethodHandleDesc;
021
022import java.util.ArrayList;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Objects;
026import java.util.Optional;
027
028import java.util.function.Predicate;
029
030import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
031import javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind;
032import javax.lang.model.element.Parameterizable;
033import javax.lang.model.element.QualifiedNameable;
034
035import javax.lang.model.type.ArrayType;
036import javax.lang.model.type.DeclaredType;
037import javax.lang.model.type.IntersectionType;
038import javax.lang.model.type.ReferenceType;
039import javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind;
040import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
041import javax.lang.model.type.TypeVariable;
042import javax.lang.model.type.WildcardType;
043
044import org.microbean.construct.Domain;
045
046import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.BSM_INVOKE;
047
048/**
049 * A partial implementation of a {@link Matcher} that tests if one {@link TypeMirror} <dfn>matches</dfn> another.
050 *
051 * <p>This class consists primarily of utility methods useful for assisting in implementing type matching according to a
052 * variety of rules, such as those described or implemented by <a
053 * href="https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.1/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.1#typesafe_resolution">CDI</a> or <a
054 * href="https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/blob/main/spring-core/src/main/java/org/springframework/util/TypeUtils.java">the
055 * Spring framework</a>.
056 *
057 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
058 */
059public abstract class AbstractTypeMatcher implements Constable, Matcher<TypeMirror, TypeMirror> {
060
061
062  /*
063   * Static fields.
064   */
065
066
067  private static final ClassDesc CD_Domain = ClassDesc.of("org.microbean.construct.Domain");
068
069
070  /*
071   * Instance fields.
072   */
073
074
075  private final Domain domain;
076
077
078  /*
079   * Constructors.
080   */
081
082
083  /**
084   * Creates a new {@link AbstractTypeMatcher}.
085   *
086   * @param domain a {@link Domain}; must not be {@code null}
087   */
088  protected AbstractTypeMatcher(final Domain domain) {
089    super();
090    this.domain = Objects.requireNonNull(domain, "domain");
091  }
092
093
094  /*
095   * Instance methods.
096   */
097
098
099  // Is t a type that CDI considers to be "parameterized" in its own sense of the word, not the sense used by the Java
100  // Language Specification?
101  //
102  // There are some cases, but not all, where CDI (incorrectly) considers an array type to be something that can be
103  // parameterized, or else "bean" and "event type parameter" resolution would never work. See
104  // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/76493672/when-cdi-speaks-of-a-parameterized-type-does-it-also-incorrectly-mean-array-typ.
105  //
106  // The semantics CDI wants to express are really: can t *yield* a raw type, for a certain definition of "yield"? See
107  // Types#yieldsRawType(TypeMirror).
108  /*
109  protected final boolean cdiParameterized(final TypeMirror t) {
110    return this.yieldsRawType(t);
111  }
112  */
113
114  // Is payload's condensed super bound (lower bound) covariantly assignable to receiver?
115  //
116  // Since either of a wildcard type's bounds may be a type variable, and since a type variable's bound may be an
117  // intersection type, it follows that after condensation either of a wildcard type's bounds may be a list of actual
118  // types.
119  //
120  // Therefore this is really: Is there one bound among payload's actual super bounds that is assignable to receiver?
121  /*
122  protected boolean assignableFromCondensedSuperBound(final ReferenceType receiver, final WildcardType payload) {
123    assert payload.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
124    final ReferenceType superBound = (ReferenceType)payload.getSuperBound();
125    return superBound == null || switch (superBound.getKind()) {
126    case ARRAY, DECLARED, TYPEVAR -> covariantlyAssignable(receiver, superBound);
127    // case TYPEVAR -> covariantlyAssignable(receiver, (ReferenceType)this.types.condense(superBound));
128    default -> throw new AssertionError();
129    };
130  }
131  */
132
133  // Is candidate covariantly assignable to w's condensed extends (upper) bound?
134  /*
135  protected boolean assignableToCondensedExtendsBound(final WildcardType w, final ReferenceType candidate) {
136    assert w.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
137    final ReferenceType extendsBound = (ReferenceType)w.getExtendsBound();
138    return extendsBound == null || switch (extendsBound.getKind()) {
139    case ARRAY, DECLARED, TYPEVAR -> covariantlyAssignable(extendsBound, candidate);
140    // case TYPEVAR -> covariantlyAssignable((ReferenceType)this.types.condense(extendsBound), List.of(candidate));
141    default -> throw new AssertionError();
142    };
143  }
144  */
145
146  // Is the type argument represented by payload assignable to all of the receiver's condensed bounds?
147  //
148  // Pay close attention to how this is called, i.e. what is payload and what is receiver is often "backwards". For
149  // example:
150  //
151  //   @Inject Foo<String> foo; <-- Bean<T extends CharSequence> // is the String "actual type" (payload) assignable to T's (receiver's) CharSequence bound?
152  //   //          ^ payload!            ^ receiver!
153  //
154  // Recall that after condensing "T extends CharSequence" you get CharSequence.
155  //
156  // Recall that if, instead, you had T extends S and S extends CharSequence, condensing T still yields CharSequence.
157  /*
158  protected boolean assignableToCondensedTypeVariableBounds(final TypeVariable receiver, final TypeMirror payload) {
159    assert receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
160    return this.covariantlyAssignable(receiver, payload);
161    // return covariantlyAssignable(List.of(receiver), List.of(payload)); // deliberately List.of(payload) and not condense(payload)
162  }
163  */
164
165  // It's not immediately clear what CDI means by a type variable's upper bound. In javax.lang.model.type parlance, the
166  // upper bound of a TypeVariable could be an IntersectionType, which java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable represents as a
167  // collection of bounds. CDI blundered into this earlier: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CDI-440 and
168  // https://github.com/jakartaee/cdi/issues/682
169  //
170  // In what follows, note the strangeness as well of the reversal of assignment semantics. The *receiver* gets checked
171  // to see if it is assignable *to* the *payload*. This method itself is not responsible for those semantics.
172  //
173  // "the upper bound of the required type parameter [receiver type argument] is assignable to the upper bound, if any,
174  // of the bean type parameter [payload type argument]" (when both arguments are type variables) should *actually*
175  // read:
176  //
177  // "for each bound, PTA, of the bean type parameter [payload type argument], there is at least one bound, RTA, of the
178  // required type parameter [receiver type argument], which is assignable to PTA."
179  //
180  // (Spin through all PTAs, and for each PTA:
181  //   (Spin through all RTAs, and find one assignable to PTA.)
182  //
183  // The TCK enforces this, even though it's not in the specification (!).
184  //
185  // Weld's implementation confuses type parameters with arguments, just like the specification. They have a series of
186  // methods implemented as part of PR 614 (https://github.com/weld/core/pull/614) named "parametersMatch" [arguments
187  // match].
188  //
189  // Weld also has methods named things like "getUppermostTypeVariableBounds" and "getUppermostBounds". These appear to
190  // "condense" useless type variable extensions to "get to" the "real" types involved. So T extends S extends String
191  // becomes String.
192  //
193  // Digging deeper, you (I) might think getUppermostTypeVariableBounds(tv) is just erase(tv) applied recursively. But I
194  // think you would be wrong.
195  //
196  // Start with:
197  // https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/181845ae46157a9bb3bf8e2a328fa59eddc0273a/src/jdk.compiler/share/classes/com/sun/tools/javac/code/Types.java#L2450
198  //
199  // Compare vs.:
200  // https://github.com/weld/core/blob/e894d1699ff1c91332605f5ecae5f53410effb81/impl/src/main/java/org/jboss/weld/resolution/AbstractAssignabilityRules.java#L57-L62
201  //
202  // To illustrate the difference between the two operations, recursive erasure (according to the Java Language
203  // Specification) of the pseudo-declaration T extends S extends List<String> & Serializable would yield, simply, List
204  // (T would erease to "the erasure of its leftmost bound", which would be the erasure of S, which would be "the
205  // erasure of its leftmost bound", which would be the erasure of List<String>, which would be List. Serializable just
206  // gets dropped.)
207  //
208  // By contrast, Weld's getUppermostTypeVariableBounds(T) operation would yield [List<String>, Serializable] (have not
209  // tested this with code, just reading).
210  //
211  // I think this is what the javac compiler calls, somewhat confusingly, "classBound":
212  // https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-24%2B7/src/jdk.compiler/share/classes/com/sun/tools/javac/code/Types.java#L2760-L2796
213  //
214  // (With the javax.lang.model.type.* model, this condensing isn't needed.)
215  // So then:
216  //
217  // For every bound in (condensed) receiverBounds, is there a bound in (condensed) payloadBounds that is covariantly
218  // assignable to it?
219  //
220  // Note that the "backwards" nature of that sentence has already happened before we get to this method.
221  //
222  // (Is there one bound in (condensed) payloadBounds that matches all bounds in (condensed) receiverBounds?)
223  //
224  // (Because of the javax.lang.model.* isAssignable() semantics, condensing turns out to be entirely unnecessary.)
225  /*
226   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@linkplain #covariantlyAssignable(TypeMirror, List) at least one
227   * <code>TypeMirror</code> in <code>payloadBounds</code> is covariantly assignable to all of the
228   * <code>TypeMirror</code>s in <code>receiverBounds</code>}.
229   *
230   * @param receiverBounds a {@link List} of {@link TypeMirror}s representing the bounds of
231   */
232  /*
233  protected final boolean covariantlyAssignable(final List<? extends TypeMirror> receiverBounds, List<? extends TypeMirror> payloadBounds) {
234    for (final TypeMirror receiverBound : receiverBounds) {
235      if (!covariantlyAssignable(receiverBound, payloadBounds)) {
236        return false;
237      }
238    }
239    return true;
240    / *
241    payloadBounds = this.types.condense(payloadBounds);
242    for (final TypeMirror receiverBound : this.types.condense(receiverBounds)) {
243      if (!covariantlyAssignable(receiverBound, payloadBounds)) {
244        return false;
245      }
246    }
247    return true;
248    * /
249  }
250  */
251
252  // Is there a bound in payloadBounds that is assignable to receiver using Java, not CDI, assignability semantics?
253  /*
254  protected final boolean covariantlyAssignable(final TypeMirror receiver, final List<? extends TypeMirror> payloadBounds) {
255    for (final TypeMirror payloadBound : payloadBounds) {
256      if (covariantlyAssignable(receiver, payloadBound)) {
257        return true;
258      }
259    }
260    return false;
261    / *
262    return switch (receiver.getKind()) {
263    case ARRAY, DECLARED -> {
264      for (final TypeMirror condensedPayloadBound : payloadBounds) {
265        switch (condensedPayloadBound.getKind()) {
266        case ARRAY:
267        case DECLARED:
268          if (covariantlyAssignable(receiver, (ReferenceType)condensedPayloadBound)) {
269            yield true;
270          }
271          break;
272        default:
273          throw new IllegalArgumentException("payloadBounds: " + payloadBounds);
274        }
275      }
276      yield false;
277    }
278    default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("receiver: " + receiver + "; kind: " + receiver.getKind());
279    };
280    * /
281  }
282  */
283
284  /**
285   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code payload} is <dfn>covariantly assignable</dfn> to {@code receiver}.
286   *
287   * <p>The default implementation of this method returns the result of invoking {@link Domain#assignable(TypeMirror,
288   * TypeMirror)} on the return value of an invocation of the {@link #domain()} method, supplying the two arguments
289   * <strong>in reverse order</strong>.</p>
290   *
291   * @param receiver a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}; the "left hand side" of the putative assignment
292   *
293   * @param payload a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}; the "right hand side" of the putative assignment
294   *
295   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code payload} is <dfn>covariantly assignable</dfn> to {@code receiver}
296   *
297   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
298   *
299   * @see Domain#assignable(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) 
300   */
301  // Is classOrArrayTypePayload assignable to receiver following the rules of Java assignability
302  // (i.e. covariance)?
303  protected boolean covariantlyAssignable(final TypeMirror receiver, final TypeMirror payload) {
304    return Objects.requireNonNull(receiver, "receiver") == payload || this.domain().assignable(payload, receiver); // yes, "backwards"
305  }
306
307  /**
308   * Returns an {@link Optional} housing a {@link ConstantDesc} that represents this {@link AbstractTypeMatcher}
309   * implementation.
310   *
311   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.</p>
312   *
313   * <p>The default implementation of this method relies on the presence of a {@code public} constructor that accepts a
314   * single {@link Domain}-typed argument.</p>
315   *
316   * <p>The {@link Optional} returned by an invocation of this method may be, and often will be, {@linkplain
317   * Optional#isEmpty() empty}.</p>
318   *
319   * @return an {@link Optional} housing a {@link ConstantDesc} that represents this {@link AbstractTypeMatcher}
320   * implementation; never {@code null}
321   *
322   * @see Constable#describeConstable()
323   */
324  @Override // Constable
325  public Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
326    return (this.domain() instanceof Constable c ? c.describeConstable() : Optional.<ConstantDesc>empty())
327      .map(domainDesc -> DynamicConstantDesc.of(BSM_INVOKE,
328                                                MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(ClassDesc.of(this.getClass().getName()),
329                                                                               CD_Domain),
330                                                domainDesc));
331  }
332
333  /**
334   * Returns the {@link Domain} used by this {@link AbstractTypeMatcher} implementation.
335   *
336   * @return the {@link Domain} used by this {@link AbstractTypeMatcher} implementation; never {@code
337   * null}
338   *
339   * @see #AbstractTypeMatcher(Domain)
340   *
341   * @see Domain
342   */
343  protected final Domain domain() {
344    return this.domain;
345  }
346
347  // Is payload "identical to" receiver, following the intent of CDI? The relation "identical to" is not defined in the
348  // specification. Does it mean ==? Does it mean equals()? Does it mean
349  // javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)? Something else?
350  //
351  // This implementation chooses Domain#sameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror), but with one
352  // change. Domain#sameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) is usually backed by the
353  // javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) method. That method will return false if either
354  // argument is a wildcard type. This method first checks to see if the arguments are the same Java references (==),
355  // regardless of type.
356  /**
357   * A utility method that returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link AbstractTypeMatcher} implementation considers
358   * the two supplied {@link TypeMirror}s to be <dfn>identical</dfn>.
359   *
360   * <p>The default implementation returns {@code true} if {@code receiver} is literally the very same Java object
361   * reference as {@code payload}, or if an invocation of {@link Domain#sameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)} with the two
362   * arguments returns {@code true}.</p>
363   *
364   * <p>(As an arbitrary counterexample, Spring <a
365   * href="https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/blob/v6.2.1/spring-core/src/main/java/org/springframework/util/TypeUtils.java#L57">relies
366   * on</a> {@linkplain Object#equals(Object) the <code>equals</code> method of <code>java.lang.reflect.Type</code>},
367   * whose behavior is effectively undefined.)</p>
368   *
369   * @param receiver a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
370   *
371   * @param payload a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
372   *
373   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link AbstractTypeMatcher} implementation considers the two supplied
374   * {@link TypeMirror}s to be identical; {@code false} otherwise
375   *
376   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
377   *
378   * @see Domain#sameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
379   */
380  protected boolean identical(final TypeMirror receiver, final TypeMirror payload) {
381    // CDI has an undefined notion of "identical to". This method attempts to divine and implement the intent. Recall
382    // that javax.lang.model.* compares types with "sameType" semantics.
383    return
384      Objects.requireNonNull(receiver, "receiver") == Objects.requireNonNull(payload, "payload") ||
385      this.domain().sameType(receiver, payload);
386  }
387
388  // Return t if its element declares a non-generic class, or if it is the raw type usage of a generic class.
389  /**
390   * Returns the supplied {@link TypeMirror} if it is a kind that cannot {@linkplain #yieldsRawType(TypeMirror) yield a
391   * raw type}, or the {@linkplain Domain#rawType(TypeMirror) raw type} that {@code t} yields.
392   *
393   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
394   *
395   * @return the supplied {@link TypeMirror} if it is a kind that cannot {@linkplain #yieldsRawType(TypeMirror) yield a
396   * raw type}, or the {@linkplain Domain#rawType(TypeMirror) raw type} that {@code t} yields
397   *
398   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
399   *
400   * @see #yieldsRawType(TypeMirror)
401   *
402   * @see Domain#rawType(TypeMirror)
403   */
404  protected TypeMirror nonGenericClassOrRawType(final TypeMirror t) {
405    return this.yieldsRawType(t) ? this.domain().rawType(t) : t;
406  }
407
408  /**
409   * A convenience method that returns {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is a {@linkplain TypeKind#TYPEVAR type
410   * variable} whose {@linkplain TypeVariable#getUpperBound() upper bound} is an unbounded type variable (recursively),
411   * or is the type declared by {@code java.lang.Object}.
412   *
413   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
414   *
415   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is a {@linkplain TypeKind#TYPEVAR type variable} whose {@linkplain
416   * TypeVariable#getUpperBound() upper bound} is an unbounded type variable (recursively), or is the type declared by
417   * {@code java.lang.Object}
418   *
419   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
420   *
421   * @see TypeVariable#getUpperBound()
422   *
423   * @see Domain#javaLangObject(TypeMirror)
424   */
425  // Is t an unbounded type variable?
426  //
427  // CDI does not define what an "unbounded type variable" is. This method attempts to divine and implement the intent.
428  //
429  // Since according to the Java Language Specification, all type variables have an upper bound, which in the
430  // pathological case is java.lang.Object, it would seem that "unbounded" means "has java.lang.Object as its upper
431  // bound".
432  //
433  // It is not clear in the case of T extends S whether T is an unbounded TypeVariable or not. This interpretation
434  // behaves as if it is.
435  //
436  // Weld seems to take the position that an unbounded type variable is one that has java.lang.Object as its sole upper
437  // bound; see
438  // https://github.com/weld/core/blob/5.1.2.Final/impl/src/main/java/org/jboss/weld/util/Types.java#L258. Under this
439  // interpretation T extends S would not be considered an unbounded type variable. Type variable bounds are erased in
440  // every other situation in CDI.
441  protected final boolean unboundedTypeVariable(TypeMirror t) {
442    if (t.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR) {
443      t = ((TypeVariable)t).getUpperBound();
444      return this.domain().javaLangObject(t) || this.unboundedTypeVariable(t);
445    }
446    return false;
447    /*
448    return switch (t.getKind()) {
449    case TYPEVAR -> {
450      final List<? extends TypeMirror> condensedBounds = this.types.condense(((TypeVariable)t).getUpperBound());
451      yield condensedBounds.size() == 1 && this.types.isJavaLangObject(condensedBounds.get(0));
452    }
453    default -> false;
454    };
455    */
456  }
457
458  /**
459   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is either a parameterized type or an array type whose element type is
460   * parameterized.
461   *
462   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
463   *
464   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is either a parameterized type or an array type whose element type is
465   * parameterized
466   *
467   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
468   *
469   * @see Domain#rawType(TypeMirror)
470   */
471  // Can t *yield* a raw type? (Is t parameterized or an array type with a parameterized element type?)
472  //
473  // We say that to yield a raw type, t must be either:
474  //
475  // * a declared type with at least one type argument ("parameterized")
476  // * an array type with a parameterized element type
477  protected final boolean yieldsRawType(final TypeMirror t) {
478    final TypeMirror rawT = this.domain().rawType(t);
479    return rawT != null && rawT != t;
480    // return parameterized(t) || t.getKind() == TypeKind.ARRAY && parameterized(elementType(t));
481  }
482
483
484
485  /*
486   * Static methods.
487   */
488
489
490  /**
491   * A convenience method that returns {@code true} if and only if all elements supplied by the supplied {@link
492   * Iterable} "pass" the supplied {@link Predicate}.
493   *
494   * @param <T> the type of an element
495   *
496   * @param ts an {@link Iterable}; must not be {@code null}
497   *
498   * @param p a {@link Predicate}; must not be {@code null}
499   *
500   * @return {@code true} if and only if all elements supplied by the supplied {@link Iterable} "pass" the supplied
501   * {@link Predicate}; {@code false} otherwise
502   *
503   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
504   */
505  protected static final <T> boolean allAre(final Iterable<? extends T> ts, final Predicate<? super T> p) {
506    for (final T t : ts) {
507      if (!p.test(t)) {
508        return false;
509      }
510    }
511    return true;
512  }
513
514  /**
515   * A convenience method that returns {@code true} if and only if the {@link QualifiedNameable} that {@linkplain
516   * DeclaredType#asElement() declares} the supplied {@link DeclaredType} {@linkplain
517   * QualifiedNameable#getQualifiedName() has a qualified name} that is {@linkplain
518   * javax.lang.model.element.Name#contentEquals(CharSequence) equal to} the supplied {@link CharSequence}.
519   *
520   * @param t a {@link DeclaredType}; must not be {@code null}
521   *
522   * @param n a {@link CharSequence}; must not be {@code null}
523   *
524   * @return {@code true} if and only if the {@link QualifiedNameable} that {@linkplain DeclaredType#asElement()
525   * declares} the supplied {@link DeclaredType} {@linkplain QualifiedNameable#getQualifiedName() has a qualified name}
526   * that is {@linkplain javax.lang.model.element.Name#contentEquals(CharSequence) equal to} the supplied {@link
527   * CharSequence}
528   *
529   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
530   */
531  // Regardless of its reported TypeKind, does t's declaring TypeElement bear the supplied fully qualified name?
532  //
533  // Throws ClassCastException if the return value of t.asElement() is not a TypeElement.
534  protected static final boolean named(final DeclaredType t, final CharSequence n) {
535    // (No getKind() check on purpose.)
536    return ((QualifiedNameable)t.asElement()).getQualifiedName().contentEquals(n);
537  }
538
539}
